description: ServiceRouterSpec defines the desired state of ServiceRouter

routes.description: Routes are the list of routes to consider when processing L7 requests. The first route to match in the list is terminal and stops further evaluation. Traffic that fails to match any of the provided routes will be routed to the default service.

destination.description: Destination controls how to proxy the matching request(s) to a service.

namespace.description: Namespace is the Consul namespace to resolve the service from instead of the current namespace. If empty the current namespace is assumed.

numRetries.description: NumRetries is the number of times to retry the request when a retryable result occurs

prefixRewrite.description: PrefixRewrite defines how to rewrite the HTTP request path before proxying it to its final destination. This requires that either match.http.pathPrefix or match.http.pathExact be configured on this route.

requestHeaders.description: Allow HTTP header manipulation to be configured.

add.description: Add is a set of name -> value pairs that should be appended to the request or response (i.e. allowing duplicates if the same header already exists).

remove.description: Remove is the set of header names that should be stripped from the request or response.

set.description: Set is a set of name -> value pairs that should be added to the request or response, overwriting any existing header values of the same name.

requestTimeout.description: RequestTimeout is the total amount of time permitted for the entire downstream request (and retries) to be processed.

responseHeaders.description: HTTPHeaderModifiers is a set of rules for HTTP header modification that should be performed by proxies as the request passes through them. It can operate on either request or response headers depending on the context in which it is used.

add.description: Add is a set of name -> value pairs that should be appended to the request or response (i.e. allowing duplicates if the same header already exists).

remove.description: Remove is the set of header names that should be stripped from the request or response.

set.description: Set is a set of name -> value pairs that should be added to the request or response, overwriting any existing header values of the same name.

retryOnConnectFailure.description: RetryOnConnectFailure allows for connection failure errors to trigger a retry.

retryOnStatusCodes.description: RetryOnStatusCodes is a flat list of http response status codes that are eligible for retry.

service.description: Service is the service to resolve instead of the default service. If empty then the default service name is used.

serviceSubset.description: ServiceSubset is a named subset of the given service to resolve instead of the one defined as that service's DefaultSubset. If empty, the default subset is used.

match.description: Match is a set of criteria that can match incoming L7 requests. If empty or omitted it acts as a catch-all.

http.description: HTTP is a set of http-specific match criteria.

header.description: Header is a set of criteria that can match on HTTP request headers. If more than one is configured all must match for the overall match to apply.

exact.description: Exact will match if the header with the given name is this value.

invert.description: Invert inverts the logic of the match.

name.description: Name is the name of the header to match.

prefix.description: Prefix will match if the header with the given name has this prefix.

present.description: Present will match if the header with the given name is present with any value.

regex.description: Regex will match if the header with the given name matches this pattern.

suffix.description: Suffix will match if the header with the given name has this suffix.

methods.description: Methods is a list of HTTP methods for which this match applies. If unspecified all http methods are matched.

pathExact.description: PathExact is an exact path to match on the HTTP request path.

pathPrefix.description: PathPrefix is a path prefix to match on the HTTP request path.

pathRegex.description: PathRegex is a regular expression to match on the HTTP request path.

queryParam.description: QueryParam is a set of criteria that can match on HTTP query parameters. If more than one is configured all must match for the overall match to apply.

exact.description: Exact will match if the query parameter with the given name is this value.

name.description: Name is the name of the query parameter to match on.

present.description: Present will match if the query parameter with the given name is present with any value.

regex.description: Regex will match if the query parameter with the given name matches this pattern.
